Earth Science Data Category

A taxonomy

Concept Scheme

URI
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category
Publisher(s)
Geological Survey of Queensland
Creator(s)
Geological Survey of Queensland
Created
2019-09-06T08:17:57
Modified
2019-09-11T08:46:46
Source
Modified from the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC). Relevant earth science categories have been extracted and augmented with narrower terms relevant for industry and research institutions.
Ontology RDF
RDF (turtle)

Description

A classification that facilitates identification of the Fields of Research, or topics, to which a dataset, activity, or entity pertain.

Table of Contents

  1. Concepts
  2. Namespaces
  3. Legend

Airborne Spectralcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/airborne-spectral
Definition Remotely sensed spectral imaging obtained from an airborne platform.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/spectral-imagingcp

Atmospheric Sciencescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/atmospheric-sciences
Definition The study of the Earth's atmosphere and its various inner-working physical processes.
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/0401cp

Basin Analysiscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/basin-analysis
Definition a geologic method by which the history of a sedimentary basin is revealed, by analyzing the sediment fill itself. Aspects of the sediment, namely its composition, primary structures, and internal architecture, can be synthesized into a history of the basin fill. Source:Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040301cp

Biological Sciencescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/biological-sciences
Definition The natural science that studies life and living organisms, including their physical structure, chemical processes, molecular interactions, physiological mechanisms, development and evolution.
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/ecologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/06cp

Core Spectralcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/core-spectral
Definition Spectral imaging (typically hyperspectral) of rock samples such as core.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/spectral-imagingcp

Demographycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/demography
Definition The statistical study of populations, especially human beings.
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/1603cp

Ecologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/ecology
Definition A branch of biology concerning interactions among organisms and their biophysical environment, which includes both biotic and abiotic components.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/biological-sciencescp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/0602cp

Electrical and Electromagnetic Methods in Geophysicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/electrical-and-electromagnetic-methods-in-geophysics
Definition Geophysical methods based on electrical and electromagnetic phenomena that respond to the electrical properties of the subsurface. Source: Cambridge.org
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/electrical-geophysicscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040401cp

Electrical Geophysicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/electrical-geophysics
Definition There are a variety of different electrical methods that used to image different electrical properties of the subsurface. The Resistivity technique is used to determine the resistivity of subsurface materials, the Induced Polarization (IP) technique is used to measure the decay of voltage in the ground, and the Self Potential (SP) technique looks for natural voltage sources underground. Source: Dept. Energy and Mining, Gov. of S.A.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/electrical-and-electromagnetic-methods-in-geophysicscp

Engineeringcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/engineering
Definition The use of scientific principles to design and build machines, structures, and other items, including bridges, tunnels, roads, vehicles, and buildings.
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geomechanics-and-resources-geotechnical-engineeringcp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/environmental-engineeringcp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/09cp

Environmental Engineeringcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/environmental-engineering
Definition A professional engineering discipline that takes from broad scientific topics like chemistry, biology, ecology, geology, hydraulics, hydrology, microbiology, and mathematics to create solutions that will protect and also improve the health of living organisms and improve the quality of the environment. Source:Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/engineeringcp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/0907cp

Environmental Sciencescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/environmental-sciences
Definition an interdisciplinary academic field that integrates physical, biological and information sciences to the study of the environment, and the solution of environmental problems.
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/05cp

Extract Geochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/extract-geochemistry
Definition Analysis of the chemical and physical properties of products extracted from rocks in the subsurface.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistrycp

Extraterrestrial Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/extraterrestrial-geology
Definition A planetary science discipline concerned with the geology of the celestial bodies such as the planets and their moons, asteroids, comets, and meteorites. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040302cp

Geochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistry
Definition The study of the chemistry of the Earth and within solid bodies of the solar system, including the distribution, circulation and abundance of elements (and their ions and isotopes), molecules, minerals, rocks and fluids. Source Schulmberger Oilfield Glossary
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistry-not-elsewhere-classifiedcp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/isotope-geochemistrycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/extract-geochemistrycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/organic-geochemistrycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/inorganic-geochemistrycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/0402cp

Geochemistry Not Elsewhere Classifiedcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistry-not-elsewhere-classified
Definition Geochemical data and information not otherwise described by other sub-categories of geochemistry.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistrycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040299cp

Geochronologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochronology
Definition The study of the relative or absolute age of rocks, minerals and fossils. Absolute age is the measurement of age in years, but 'absolute' ages typically have some amount of error and are inexact. Relative age, in contrast, is the approximate age of rocks, fossils or minerals made by determining the age of the material relative to other surrounding material. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040303cp

Geodynamicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geodynamics
Definition A subfield of geophysics dealing with dynamics of the Earth. It applies physics, chemistry and mathematics to the understanding of how mantle convection leads to plate tectonics and geologic phenomena such as seafloor spreading, mountain building, volcanoes, earthquakes, faulting and so on. It also attempts to probe the internal activity by measuring magnetic fields, gravity, and seismic waves, as well as the mineralogy of rocks and their isotopic composition. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040402cp

Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geology
Definition An earth science concerned with the solid Earth, the rocks of which it is composed, and the processes by which they change over time. Geology can also include the study of the solid features of any terrestrial planet or natural satellite such as Mars or the Moon. Modern geology significantly overlaps all other earth sciences, including hydrology and the atmospheric sciences, and so is treated as one major aspect of integrated earth system science and planetary science. Source: Wikipedia
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochronologycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/marine-geosciencecp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/mineralogy-and-crystallographycp

Geology Not Elsewhere Classifiedcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geology-not-elsewhere-classified
Definition Geological data and information not otherwise described by other sub-categories of geochemistry.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp

Geomechanicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geomechanics
Definition The geologic specialty that deals with understanding how rocks, stresses, pressures, and temperatures interact. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp

Geomechanics and Resources Geotechnical Engineeringcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geomechanics-and-resources-geotechnical-engineering
Definition The application of scientific methods and engineering principles to the acquisition, interpretation, and use of knowledge of materials of the Earth's crust and earth materials for the solution of engineering problems and the design of engineering works. Source:Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/engineeringcp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/091402cp

Geomorphology And Regolith And Landscape Evolutioncp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geomorphology-and-regolith-and-landscape-evolution
Definition The scientific study of the origin and evolution of topographic and bathymetric features created by physical, chemical or biological processes operating at or near the Earth's surface. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040601cp

Geophysical Fluid Dynamicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysical-fluid-dynamics
Definition The fluid dynamics of naturally occurring flows, such as lava flows, oceans, and planetary atmospheres, on Earth and other planets. Souce: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040403cp

Geophysicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysics
Definition The study of the physics of the Earth, especially its electrical, gravitational and magnetic fields and propagation of elastic (seismic) waves within it. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary

Definition The study of heatflow and radioactive activity within the Earth.

Glaciologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/glaciology
Definition The scientific study of glaciers, or more generally ice and natural phenomena that involve ice. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040602cp

Gravitycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/gravity
Definition A versatile geophysical technique used to detect and identify subsurface bodies and anomalies within the Earth. It is based on the density changes of rock bodies and their effect on the acceleration of gravity. Source: SEG wiki
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040405cp

Hydrocarbon Occurrencescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/hydrocarbon-occurrences
Definition The quantification of the physical properties, chemical properties, volumes, systems of accumulation (i.e. plays and prospects), and limitations to development of hydrocarbon accumulations.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/resource-geologycp

Hydrogeochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/hydrogeochemistry
Definition The science that uses the tools and principles of chemistry to explain the mechanisms behind major geological systems such as the Earth's crust and its oceans.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/Geochemistrycp

Hydrogeologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/hydrogeology
Definition The area of geology that deals with the distribution and movement of groundwater in the soil and rocks of the Earth's crust (commonly in aquifers). Source: SEG wiki
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040603cp

Ichnologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/ichnology
Definition The branch of paleontology concerned with the study of fossilized tracks, trails, burrows, borings, or other trace fossils as evidence of the occurrence or behavior of the organisms that produced them. Source: dictionary.com
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontologycp

Igneous and Metamorphic Petrologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/igneous-and-metamorphic-petrology
Definition The branch of petrology that describes the composition and texture of igneous and metamorphic rocks. Igneous and metamorphic petrology are commonly categorized together because they both contain heavy use of chemistry, chemical methods, and phase diagrams. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petrologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040304cp

Inorganic Geochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/inorganic-geochemistry
Definition The study of the chemistry of inorganic rocks, minerals, and other earth materials that are not currently or once living.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistrycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040202cp

Invertebrate Palaeontologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/invertebrate-palaeontology
Definition Invertebrate paleontology deals with invertebrate fossils such as molluscs, arthropods, annelid worms and echinoderms. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontologycp

Isotope Geochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/isotope-geochemistry
Definition The determination of the relative and absolute concentrations of the elements and their isotopes in the Earth and on Earth's surface. Source: Kendall, Carol; Caldwell, Eric A. (1998). 'Chapter 2: Fundamentals of Isotope Geochemistry'. In Kendall, C.; McDonnell, J. J. (eds.). Isotope Tracers in Catchment Hydrology. Amsterdam: Elsevier Science. pp. 51-86.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistrycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040203cp

Magneticscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/magnetics
Definition Magnetic surveys are a geophysical method to image anomalies in the magnetic field of the earth caused by source bodies within the sub-surface. Source: SEG wiki
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040406cp

Marine Geosciencecp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/marine-geoscience
Definition The study of the history and structure of the ocean floor. It involves geophysical, geochemical, sedimentological and paleontological investigations of the ocean floor and coastal zone. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040305cp

Mineral Occurrencescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/mineral-occurrences
Definition The quantification of the physical properties, chemical properties, volumes, systems of accumulation (e.g. ore body charictarization), and limitations to development of mineral occurences.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/resource-geologycp

Mineralogy and Crystallographycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/mineralogy-and-crystallography
Definition The scientific study of the chemistry, crystal structure, and physical (including optical) properties of minerals and mineralized artifacts. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp

Natural Hazardscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/natural-hazards
Definition The study of natural phenomena that might have a negative effect on humans or the environment. Specifically geophysical hazards encompassing geological and meteorological phenomena such as earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, wildfires, cyclonic storms, floods, droughts, avalanches and landslides. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040604cp

Organic Geochemistrycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/organic-geochemistry
Definition The study of the role of processes and compounds that are derived from living or once-living organisms. Source: Killops, Stephen D.; Killops, Vanessa J. (2013). Introduction to Organic Geochemistry. John Wiley & Sons.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geochemistrycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040204cp

Organic Petrologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/organic-petrology
Definition Organic petrology involves the study of organic matter (OM) in rocks including its origin and thermal maturity due to burial within the earth's crust. Source: CSIRO
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petrologycp

Palaeobotanycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeobotany
Definition Paleobotany studies fossil plants, algae, and fungi. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontologycp

Palaeoclimatologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeoclimatology
Definition The study of changes in climate taken on the scale of the entire history of Earth. It uses a variety of proxy methods from the Earth and life sciences to obtain data previously preserved within rocks, sediments, ice sheets, tree rings, corals, shells, and microfossils to determine the past states of the Earth's various climate regions and its atmospheric system. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040605cp

Palaeontologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontology
Definition The study of fossilized, or preserved, remnants of plant and animal life. Changes in the Earth through time can be documented by observing changes in the fossils in successive strata and the environments in which they formed or were preserved. Fossils can also be compared with their extant relatives to assess evolutionary changes. Correlations of strata can be aided by studying their fossil content, a discipline called biostratigraphy. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/vertebrate-palaeontologycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/ichnologycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeobotanycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palynologycp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/invertebrate-palaeontologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040308cp

Palynologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palynology
Definition Palynology, the study of pollen and spores produced by land plants and protists, straddles paleontology and botany, as it deals with both living and fossil organisms. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontologycp

Passive Seismiccp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/passive-seismic
Definition The detection of natural low frequency earth movements, commonly with the purpose of discerning geological structures and locating underground oil, gas, or other resources. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/seismic-surveyscp

Petroleum and Coal Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petroleum-and-coal-geology
Definition The branch of geology that studies the processes of fossil fuel formation (coal, oil and gas).
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp

Petrologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petrology
Definition The branch of geology that studies rocks and the conditions under which they form. Sometimes synonymous with lithology that studies the macroscopic hand-sample or outcrop-scale description of rocks. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp

Petrophysicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petrophysics
Definition Petrophysics is the study of physical and chemical rock properties and their interactions with fluids. A major application of petrophysics is in studying reservoirs for the hydrocarbon industry. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geography

Quarry Resourcescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/quarry-resources
Definition The quantification of the physical properties, chemical properties, volumes, and limitations to development of quarry product accumulations. Quarry resources include, but may not be limited to, hardrock, sand and gravel.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/resource-geologycp

Quaternary Environmentscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/quaternary-environments
Definition The branch of geology that study developments from 2.6 million years ago onwards. In particular Quaternary geology study the process and deposits that developed during the quaternary, a period characterized by glacial-interglacial cycles. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040606cp

Reservoir Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/reservoir-geology
Definition The study of subsurface rock formations that contain hydrocarbon accumulations. In particular quantification of reservoir properities such as porosity, permeability, fluid saturations, and fluid contacts.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petroleum-and-coal-geologycp

Resource Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/resource-geology
Definition The study of geology in the context of economic development and the quantification of resource potential of accumulations such as hydrocarbons, mineral ore bodies, and coal deposits.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/mineral-occurrencescp

Satellite Spectralcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/satellite-spectral
Definition Remotely sensed spectral imaging obtained from a platform in orbit outside the atmosphere of Earth.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/spectral-imagingcp

Sedimentary Petrologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/sedimentary-petrology
Definition The study of the composition, characteristics, and origin of sediments and sedimentary rocks. Source: AGI
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/petrologycp

Sedimentologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/sedimentology
Definition The scientific study of sedimentary rocks and of the processes by which they were formed; the description, classification, origin, and interpretation of sediments. Source: AGI
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040310cp

Seismic Surveyscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/seismic-surveys
Definition The acquisition, processing, and analysis of seismic data sets measured and recorded with reference to a particular area of the Earth's surface, to evaluate the subsurface.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/seismology-and-seismic-explorationcp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/passive-seismiccp

Seismology and Seismic Explorationcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/seismology-and-seismic-exploration
Definition The scientific study of earthquakes and the propagation of elastic waves through the Earth or through other planet-like bodies. The field also includes studies of earthquake environmental effects such as tsunamis as well as diverse seismic sources such as volcanic, tectonic, oceanic, atmospheric, and artificial processes such as explosions. Seismic exploration is a method of exploration geophysics that uses the principles of seismology to estimate the properties of the Earth's subsurface from artificially generated seismic waves. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/seismic-surveyscp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040407cp

Spectral Imagingcp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/spectral-imaging
Definition Spectral imaging is imaging that uses multiple bands across the electromagnetic spectrum.
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geophysicscp
Narrower Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/satellite-spectralcp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/airborne-spectralcp
http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/core-spectralcp

Stratigraphycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/stratigraphy
Definition The study of the history, composition, relative ages and distribution of strata, and the interpretation of strata to elucidate Earth history. The comparison, or correlation, of separated strata can include study of their lithology, fossil content, and relative or absolute age, or lithostratigraphy, biostratigraphy, and chronostratigraphy. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040311cp

Structural Geologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/structural-geology
Definition Pertaining to structure, the geometry and spatial arrangement of rocks. The structure or deformation can include many mechanisms, such as folding, faulting and fracturing. Structure can usually be interpreted in terms of the deformation of the crust of the Earth as continents and tectonic plates move and collide. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040312cp

Surface Processescp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/surface-processes
Definition The study of the processes that form and change the Earth's surface. Source: University of Melbourne
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040607cp

Surfacewater Hydrologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/surfacewater-hydrology
Definition The sub-field of hydrology concerned with above-earth water, in contrast to groundwater hydrology that deals with water below the surface of the Earth. Its applications include rainfall and runoff, the routes that surface water takes (for example through rivers or reservoirs), and the occurrence of floods and droughts. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/physical-geographycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040608cp

Tectonicscp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/tectonics
Definition Also known as plate tectonics, the unifying geologic theory developed to explain observations that interactions of the brittle plates of the lithosphere with each other and with the softer underlying asthenosphere result in large-scale changes in the Earth. Source: Schlumberger Oilfield Glossary
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040313cp

Vertebrate Palaeontologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/vertebrate-palaeontology
Definition Vertebrate paleontology concentrates on fossils from the earliest fish to the immediate ancestors of modern mammals. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/palaeontologycp

Volcanologycp

URI http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/volcanology
Definition The study of volcanoes, lava, magma, and related geological, geophysical and geochemical phenomena. Source: Wikipedia
Broader Concepts http://linked.data.gov.au/def/earth-science-data-category/geologycp
Exact Matches http://purl.org/au-research/vocabulary/anzsrc-for/2008/040314cp
